citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the IACUC at this facility did not have a participating non-affiliated member. The non-affiliated
member is someone who is not affiliated in any way with the facility other than as a member of the IACUC and provides
representation for general community interests in the proper care and treatment of animals. The lack of a non-affiliated
IACUC member means that the general community interest is not being represented. At least one member of the IACUC
shall not be affiliated in any way with the facility other than as a member of the Committee, and shall not be a member of
the immediate family of a person who is affiliated with the facility. Correct by ensuring that a non-affiliated member
provides representation for the general community interests on the IACUC. Correct by July 20, 2023.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC has not completed a review of the facility's program for humane care and use of animals within the last six
months. IACUC records reviewed during this inspection indicate that IACUC semi-annual reviews of the facility’s program
for the care and use of animals last occurred in October of 2022. Regular reviews are necessary to ensure IACUC
oversight of the program and to ensure the welfare of the animals being used in research by the facility. With respect to
activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall review at least once every 6 months, the
research facility’s program for humane care and use of animals. Correct by ensuring the IACUC reviews the facility's
program for humane care and use of animals at least once every six months. Correct by July 20, 2023.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC has not completed a review of the animal facilities within the last six months. IACUC records reviewed during
this inspection indicate that IACUC semi-annual reviews of the animal facilities last occurred in October of 2022. Regular
reviews are necessary to ensure IACUC oversight of the facility and to ensure the welfare of the animals being used in
research by the facility. With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall
inspect at least once every six months, all of the research facility’s animal facilities, including animal study areas. Correct
by ensuring the IACUC inspects the animal facilities at least once every six months. Correct by July 20, 2023.

The written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for dogs has not been updated to reflect the directions of the attending
veterinarian. The facility has an agreement with a veterinarian, however, the PVC has not been reviewed and signed by
the individual. Failure to maintain a documented and signed program of veterinary care can result in a lack of
understanding and direction in the general health and care of the animals. A written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for
dogs must be established and maintained so that the facility has a current plan that provides for adequate preventative
care and treatments as deemed necessary. The plan must include all required components as listed in the Animal
Welfare Act and Animal Welfare Regulations, Part 3, Subpart A, Section 3.13.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Jonathan Tomkovitch, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
